item.title: Mary add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Mary add a quote by Janet Kagan
item.description: "That year the Ribeiro's daffodils seeded early and they seeded cockroaches. Now, ecologically speaking, even a cockroach has its place -- but these suckers bit. That didn't sound Earth-authentic to me. Not that I care, mind you, all I ask is useful. I wasn't betting on that either." -- Janet Kagan

item.title: Mary add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Mary add a quote by Charles Wright
item.description: "It may not be written in any book, but it is written— You can’t go back, you can’t repeat the unrepeatable." -- Charles Wright
